name: Neo H3
reason: True tack + firm Chinese sponge = max serve/push + brush-loop RPM.

name: H8-80
reason: Sticky with more elasticity = huge loop RPM while keeping tack bite.

name: Omega 8 China
reason: Modern sticky “Chinese” feel with very high traction on contact.

name: Omega 7 China Guang
reason: Sticky hybrid power + heavy short-game spin and loaded openers.

name: Dignics 09C
reason: Ultra-high friction hybrid: heavy openers + reliable spin in short game.

name: K3
reason: Hybrid grab at high impact: massive 3rd-ball + counterloop rotation.

name: J&H C57.5
reason: Extra-hard sticky ceiling: huge brush/drive spin once engaged.

name: J&H C55.0
reason: Very hard sticky hybrid: enormous spin when compressed cleanly.

name: Dynaryz ZGR
reason: “Tacky + grippy” build gives big bite on openers/counters.

name: BlueGrip C2
reason: Tacky + very hard sponge: heavy serve/receive and high-RPM openings.

name: C53
reason: Hard sticky hybrid: elite counterspin + opening-loop rotation.

name: Omega 8 Hybrid
reason: Sticky topsheet + tension sponge: high loop RPM with strong kick.

name: J&H C52.5
reason: Sticky BH-style hybrid: excellent spin load with easier access than C55+.

name: BlueGrip J1
reason: Extreme grip + hint of tack: big spin at speed, slightly less “dead tack.”

name: C48
reason: Sticky geometry but softer than C53: strong spin with more dwell/ease.

name: Rakza Z
reason: Sticky-grippy hybrid dwell = heavy serve/open spin; lower peak than top hard hybrids.

name: BlueGrip J2
reason: J1-like grip with softer base: slightly less peak, still very spinny.

name: BlueGrip J3
reason: Softest BlueGrip J: easy spin, lower absolute ceiling vs J1/J2.

name: Dignics 05
reason: Best-in-class mechanical grip + stability: absurd loop RPM retention.

name: Tenergy 05H
reason: Harder base raises peak brush/loop spin when swung hard.

name: J&H Z52.5
reason: High-density geometry: near-flagship loop spin; less tack bite in short game.

name: MX-S
reason: Spin-specialist pairing: high dwell + heavy opener rotation.

name: NUZN 55
reason: Very grippy hard-sponge ceiling: huge spin in power topspin/counters.

name: R53
reason: Spin-focused hard ESN feel: high RPM when you fully accelerate.

name: EL-S
reason: “Spin-first” Evolution feel: strong grip + easy heavy topspin arcs.

name: NUZN 50
reason: High-grip modern sheet: big loop spin with more forgiveness than NUZN 55.

name: Tenergy 19
reason: High dwell + grip: heavy, safe high-RPM loops.

name: Tenergy 05
reason: Classic spin reference; edged by newer max-friction designs.

name: Bluestar A1
reason: Very grippy + lively: strong spin on power loops and flicks.

name: G-1
reason: High-arc workhorse with strong grip retention; slightly less peak than top tier.

name: Dynaryz Inferno
reason: Elastic + dwell = very high counterloop/topspin rotation.

name: Dynaryz AGR
reason: Hard/direct feel: high RPM at full stroke, a touch less dwell than Inferno.

name: MX-D
reason: Big dwell and rotation; just under the top “spin specialist” sheets.

name: Dignics 80
reason: Springy-but-stable grip: high spin, less “bitey” than D05/05-family.

name: Zyre 03
reason: Explosive at full engagement; less low-speed grab than tacky hybrids.

name: Dynaryz ZGX
reason: ZGR-like concept but more dynamic: very high loop/counter spin.

name: Dynaryz ACC
reason: Stable, spinny modern tensor; slightly lower peak than harder variants.

name: Dynaryz CMD
reason: Control-tuned Dynaryz: easy spin, lower “max rip” ceiling than ACC/AGR.

name: Tronix ZGR
reason: Slight sticky + firm base: strong opening/counter spin, not top-hybrid peak.

name: BlueStorm Pro AM
reason: Premium grip + catapult balance: heavy topspin without losing control.

name: Tenergy 80
reason: Balanced continuous topspin; lower peak than D80 due to hold/stability.

name: MX-P 50
reason: Harder variant stabilizes contact under big accel: excellent peak topspin.

name: NUZN 48
reason: Slightly softer NUZN: easy heavy spin, modestly lower peak than 50/55.

name: Omega 8 Pro
reason: Modern high-tension feel: strong spin at pace, less bite in slow game.

name: Omega7 Pro
reason: Very grippy with strong arc; a step below the very top Japanese flagships.

name: Vega X
reason: Strong grip for class; top-end spin under Omega/flagship tier.

name: R50
reason: Spin-focused hard ESN: big loop RPM, slightly below newest max-friction.

name: Vega Pro
reason: Classic spinny tensor: consistent heavy loops, lower ceiling than newer designs.

name: Bluefire M1
reason: High arc + strong grip; typically trails top tier in peak/retention.

name: BlueStorm Z1
reason: Dynamic, grippy topspin rubber: strong spin, speed-leaning.

name: Rakza XX
reason: Very spinny, but more speed-forward than the spin-monsters above.

name: R48
reason: Hard lively tensor: good RPM, more speed-oriented overall.

name: BlueStorm Z2
reason: Balanced Z-series: good spin and arc, lower ceiling than Z1.

name: MX-P
reason: Classic high-grip tensor; big spin, but less ceiling than newer max-friction.

name: Rakza X
reason: Strong grip + arc; less peak bite than hardest flagships.

name: Tronix ACC
reason: Elastic topsheet: consistent spin; lower peak than top hard tensors.

name: MX-K
reason: Needs deeper engagement for max rotation; less “easy bite” than MX-P.

name: Dignics 64
reason: Speed-biased: lower arc/rotation ceiling than D05/D80 geometries.

name: Tenergy 64
reason: Fast + grippy, but lower throw limits max spin vs 05/19-type.

name: R47
reason: Solid grip and arc; slightly lower peak rotation than harder spin geometries.

name: J&H V47.5
reason: Precise/control-leaning: good spin but capped vs C/Z hybrids.

name: J&H X47.5
reason: Catapult-driven topspin: strong spin, but not a “max friction” sheet.

name: Rakza 9
reason: Speed-oriented with solid grip; lower hold at absolute peak.

name: EL-P
reason: Reliable grippy classic; less ceiling than MX/flagship tiers.

name: FX-S
reason: Easy heavy spin access; softer base caps the very top-end RPM.

name: Tenergy 05 FX
reason: 05 topsheet spins big, but sponge bottoms sooner under elite acceleration.

name: Acuda S1
reason: More direct/harder than S2: better peak brush spin, still not top tier.

name: Baracuda
reason: Classic high-arc “spin rubber”: great bite, but older-gen ceiling.

name: NUZN 45
reason: Slightly sticky + controlled tensor: strong usable spin, lower peak than NUZN 50+.

name: BlueStorm Z3
reason: Softer Z-series: good spin, reduced peak vs harder Z1/Z2.

name: Gold Arc 8
reason: Linear, grippy feel: decent dwell, lacks top-tier bite.

name: MK
reason: Slight hybrid grab: good short game/opens, controlled peak rotation.

name: C-1
reason: Catch-first control bias: easy spin, less max than harder sheets.

name: Bluefire M2
reason: Softer than M1: reduced peak spin, still good arc.

name: Acuda S2
reason: Balanced medium sponge: decent spin, less bite than M1/MX-level.

name: Rakza 7
reason: Classic grippy tensor: very usable, lower ceiling than modern high-friction.

name: S-1
reason: Speed-leaning Fastarc: still spins well, prioritizes pace.

name: Rozena
reason: Forgiving and consistent; clearly less bite than Tenergy/Dignics tier.

name: Rakza 7 Soft
reason: Softer boosts ease, reduces peak/stability at full power.

name: Vega Europe
reason: Control-focused easy spin; capped max RPM vs firmer sheets.

name: R42
reason: Control emphasis: good spin generation, lower peak due to saturation.

name: FX-P
reason: High dwell for openers; limited top-end as sponge compresses early.

name: Tronix CMD
reason: Easy spin/control; lower ceiling vs harder offensive rubbers.

name: Bluefire M3
reason: Very soft/bouncy: good dwell, peak drops when sponge saturates.

name: Acuda S3
reason: Control-leaning: lowest bite/peak in Acuda S line here.
